Attack Documentation¶

class attacks.attack.Attack(model, perturbation)[source]¶

An attack generates adversarial examples on text.

Parameters

  • model – The TensorFlow or PyTorch model to attack

  • perturbation – The type of attack to use, see Perturbations

add_output_file(file)[source]¶

When an attack runs, it will output the results to this file.

Parameters

file (str) – The path for the output file

attack(dataset, shuffle=False)[source]¶

Runs an attack on the dataset and outputs results.

Parameters

  • dataset – An iterable of (label, text) pairs to attack

  • shuffle (bool, optional) – Whether to shuffle the dataset

Returns

An iterable of the results of the attack

class attacks.attack.AttackResult(original_text, perturbed_text, original_label, perturbed_label)[source]¶

Result of an Attack run on a single (label, text_input) pair.

Parameters

  • original_text (str) – The original text

  • perturbed_text (str) – The perturbed text

  • original_label (int) – The label of the original text

  • perturbed_label (int) – The label of the perturbed text

@TODO support attacks that fail (no perturbed label/text)

diff()[source]¶

Shows the difference between the perturbed and original text using color.

@TODO abstract to work for general paraphrase.
